alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 30 at 4:26AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Utah and southeast Utah, including the following areas, in east central Utah, Arches/Grand Flat. In southeast Utah, Canyonlands/Natural Bridges, La Sal and Abajo Mountains and Southeast Utah. This Watch includes the Pack Creek Fire Burn Scar. * WHEN...From Noon through 10 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Monsoon moisture will support strong thunderstorms capable of producing heavy rainfall today.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains
